title: Arsenal legend Robert Pires names Man United's Gary Neville his toughest opponent - "He kicked me all game!"
text:

Robert Pires has revealed Manchester United legend Gary Neville is the toughest player he ever faced in football. 
The former Arsenal winger, who won the title twice with the north London outfit, was involved in a number of intense games with the Red Devils from 2000 to 2006. 
The most notable of these was the Battle of Old Trafford, a 0-0 draw that took place in the Gunners' unbeaten season of 2003/04. 
A total of seven players - five Arsenal and two Manchester United - were forced to pay fines due to their on-pitch conduct following the clash. Robert Pires won the Premier League twice with Arsenal (Photo: Getty Images) The Arsenal legend named Gary Neville his toughest opponent (Photo: Laurence Griffiths/Getty) 
Both teams had many big characters in their squads during this period, but Pires insists Neville was the toughest man he faced on the field. 
"He kicked me all game," Pires told Sky Sports. 
"Old Trafford, Highbury, he was always shouting. It was normal because of the rivalry between Arsenal and Manchester United." Pires was part of a hugely successful Arsenal team (Photo: AFP) Pires was part of the Arsenal team that reached the Champions League final (Photo: Action Images via Reuters / Tony O'Brien) 
The former France international, who won the World Cup, made 284 appearances for the Gunners and scored 84 times over a six-year period. 
He was a key player during one of the club's most successful periods and was a part of the team that reached the final of the Champions League in 2005/06. Like us on Facebook
